tool.name: collapse samples
tool.description: Collapse samples in a BIOM table and mapping file.

param.label: -b/--input_biom_fp: the biom table containing the samples to be collapsed
param.name: input_biom_fp

param.label: --collapse_fields: comma-separated list of fields to collapse on
param.name: collapse_fields

param.label: --collapse_mode: the mechanism for collapsing counts within groups; valid options are: mean, sum, random, median, first. [default: sum]
param.name: collapse_mode

param.label: --normalize: Normalize observation counts to relative abundances, so the counts within each sample sum to 1.0. [default: False]
param.name: normalize

tool.help: Collapse samples in a BIOM table and mapping file. Values in the BIOM table are collapsed in one of several different ways; see the available options for --collapse_mode. Values in the mapping file are collapsed by grouping the values if they differ for the grouped samples, and by providing the single value if they don't differ for the grouped samples. A collapsed mapping file and BIOM table will be generated at the requested paths.
